official-title.#text:
To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to allow sole proprietors and the spouses
			 and domestic partners of sole proprietors to purchase insurance on the
			 small business exchange, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the
sponsor.#text: Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Mom and Pop SHOP Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Mom and Pop SHOP Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Mom and Mom SHOP Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Mom and Mom SHOP Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Pop and Pop SHOP Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Pop and Pop SHOP Act of 2014

header.#text:
Allowing sole proprietors and their spouses and domestic partners to purchase insurance on the
			 PPACA small business exchange

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

quote.#tail:
in the preceding sentence includes an individual (and the spouse or domestic partner of such
			 individual, if any) who owns, or who is a partner in, a trade or business
			 that has no employees and that is not an S corporation (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new sentence:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1312(f)(2)(A) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1312/ss:f/p:2/sp:A

header.#text:
Treating sole proprietors and their spouses and domestic partners as qualified employers in small
			 business exchange

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, such term also includes an individual (and the spouse or domestic
			 partner of such individual, if any) who owns, or who is a partner in, a
			 trade or business that has no employees and that is not an S corporation
			 (as defined in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following new sentence:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1304(b)(2) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1304/ss:b/p:2

header.#text:
Treating sole proprietors and their spouses and domestic partners as small employers in small
			 business exchange

quote.#tail: under the preceding sentence for purposes of

quote.#text: In determining whether a health plan is a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, an individual (and the spouse or
			 domestic partner of such individual, if any) who owns, or who is a partner
			 in, a trade or business shall be considered both an employer and an
			 employee of such trade or business.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following new sentence:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1304(a)(3) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1304/ss:a/p:3

header.#text:
Treating health plans for sole proprietors and their spouses and domestic partners as group health
			 plans in small business exchange
